alert.note: Alert for Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 13 at 2:22PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of south central Wyoming, including the following area, Ferris/Seminoe/Shirley Mountains. * WHEN...Through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
